role.documentation: Boolean flag that is true when the XBRL content amends previously-filed or accepted submission.
role.label: Amendment Flag

role.documentation: Cover page.
role.label: Cover [Abstract]

role.documentation: End date of current fiscal year in the format --MM-DD.
role.label: Current Fiscal Year End Date

role.documentation: Fiscal period values are FY, Q1, Q2, and Q3.  1st, 2nd and 3rd quarter 10-Q or 10-QT statements have value Q1, Q2, and Q3 respectively, with 10-K, 10-KT or other fiscal year statements having FY.
role.label: Document Fiscal Period Focus

role.documentation: This is focus fiscal year of the document report in CCYY format. For a 2006 annual report, which may also provide financial information from prior periods, fiscal 2006 should be given as the fiscal year focus. Example: 2006.
role.label: Document Fiscal Year Focus

role.documentation: The end date of the period reflected on the cover page if a periodic report. For all other reports and registration statements containing historical data, it is the date up through which that historical data is presented.  If there is no historical data in the report, use the filing date. The format of the date is CCYY-MM-DD.
role.label: Document Period End Date

role.documentation: The type of document being provided (such as 10-K, 10-Q, 485BPOS, etc). The document type is limited to the same value as the supporting SEC submission type, or the word 'Other'.
role.label: Document Type

role.documentation: Address Line 1 such as Attn, Building Name, Street Name
role.label: Entity Address Address Line1

role.documentation: Name of the City or Town
role.label: Entity Address City Or Town

role.documentation: Code for the postal or zip code
role.label: Entity Address Postal Zip Code

role.documentation: Name of the state or province.
role.label: Entity Address State Or Province

role.documentation: A unique 10-digit SEC-issued value to identify entities that have filed disclosures with the SEC. It is commonly abbreviated as CIK.
role.label: Entity Central Index Key

role.documentation: All the names of the entities being reported upon in a document. Any legal structure used to conduct activities or to hold assets. Some examples of such structures are corporations, partnerships, limited liability companies, grantor trusts, and other trusts. This item does not include business and geographical segments which are included in the geographical or business segments domains.
role.label: Entity [Domain]

role.documentation: The aggregate market value of the voting and non-voting common equity held by non-affiliates computed by reference to the price at which the common equity was last sold, or the average bid and asked price of such common equity, as of the last business day of the registrant's most recently completed second fiscal quarter.
role.label: Entity Public Float

role.documentation: The exact name of the entity filing the report as specified in its charter, which is required by forms filed with the SEC.
role.label: Entity Registrant Name

role.documentation: The set of legal entities associated with a report.
role.label: Legal Entity [Axis]

role.documentation: Trading symbol of an instrument as listed on an exchange.
role.label: Trading Symbol

role.documentation: Information by consolidated entity or group of entities.
role.label: Consolidated Entities [Axis]

role.documentation: Entity or group of entities consolidated into reporting entity.
role.label: Consolidated Entities [Domain]

role.documentation: Information by components, eliminations, non-segment corporate-level activity and reconciling items used in consolidating a parent entity and its subsidiaries or its operating segments.
role.label: Consolidation Items [Axis]

role.documentation: Components, elimination, non-segment corporate-level activity and reconciling items used in consolidating a parent entity and its subsidiaries or its operating segments.
role.label: Consolidation Items [Domain]

role.documentation: Information by type of judicial proceeding, alternative dispute resolution or claim.
role.label: Litigation Case [Axis]

role.documentation: Judicial proceeding, alternative dispute resolution or claim. For example, but not limited to, name of case, category of litigation, or other differentiating information.
role.label: Litigation Case Type [Domain]

role.documentation: Upper limit of the provided range.
role.label: Maximum [Member]
role.verboseLabel: Estimated Range of Loss for Certain Cases Upper End

role.documentation: Lower limit of the provided range.
role.label: Minimum [Member]
role.verboseLabel: Estimated Range of Loss for Certain Cases Lower End

role.documentation: Information by product and service, or group of similar products and similar services.
role.label: Product Or Service [Axis]

role.documentation: Product or service, or a group of similar products or similar services.
role.label: Products And Services [Domain]

role.documentation: Information by statistical measurement. Includes, but is not limited to, minimum, maximum, weighted average, arithmetic average, and median.
role.label: Range [Axis]

role.documentation: Statistical measurement. Includes, but is not limited to, minimum, maximum, weighted average, arithmetic average, and median.
role.label: Range [Member]

role.documentation: Effect of a correction of an error, other prior year adjustment, or application of a new accounting pronouncement on a financial statement line item or any per share amounts. The cumulative effect of the change on retained earnings or net assets in the statement of financial position would also be represented under this domain member.
role.label: Restatement Adjustment [Member]

role.documentation: Information by revision of previously issued financial statements.
role.label: Restatement [Axis]

role.documentation: Revision of previously issued financial statements.
role.label: Restatement [Domain]

role.documentation: Information reported for future period.
role.label: Scenario Forecast [Member]

role.documentation: Scenario reported, distinguishing information from actual fact. Includes, but is not limited to, pro forma and forecast. Excludes actual facts.
role.label: Scenario Unspecified [Domain]

role.documentation: Tabular disclosure of condensed balance sheet, including, but not limited to, balance sheets of consolidated entities and consolidation eliminations.
role.label: Schedule Of Condensed Balance Sheet Table [Text Block]

role.documentation: Geographical area.
role.label: Segment Geographical [Domain]

role.documentation: Information by geographical components.
role.label: Statement Geographical [Axis]

role.documentation: Information by scenario reported, distinguishing information from actual fact. Includes, but is not limited to, pro forma and forecast. Excludes actual facts.
role.label: Statement Scenario [Axis]

role.documentation: The entire disclosure for reporting accounting changes and error corrections. It includes the conveyance of information necessary for a user of the Company's financial information to understand all aspects and required disclosure information concerning all changes and error corrections reported in the Company's financial statements for the period.
role.label: Accounting Changes And Error Corrections [Text Block]

role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
role.label: Accounts Notes And Loans Receivable [Line Items]
role.terseLabel: Accounts Notes And Loans Receivable [Line Items]

role.documentation: Information by type of receivable.
role.label: Accounts Notes Loans And Financing Receivable By Receivable Type [Axis]

role.documentation: The entire disclosure for accounts payable and accrued liabilities at the end of the reporting period.
role.label: Accounts Payable And Accrued Liabilities Disclosure [Text Block]

role.documentation: Amount, before allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration from customer for product sold and service rendered in normal course of business.
role.label: Accounts Receivable Gross

role.documentation: Amount, after allowance for credit loss, of right to consideration from customer for product sold and service rendered in normal course of business.
role.label: Accounts Receivable Net

role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities.
role.label: Accrued Liabilities Current And Noncurrent

role.documentation: This item represents obligations incurred and payable, pertaining to costs that are statutory in nature, are incurred on contractual obligations, or accumulate over time and for which invoices have not yet been received or will not be rendered.
role.label: Accrued Liabilities [Member]

role.documentation: The reserve to cover probable credit losses related to specifically identified fixed maturity real estate loans as well as probable credit losses inherent in the remainder of that loan portfolio.
role.label: Allowance For Loan And Lease Losses Real Estate

role.documentation: Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are recognized. Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past transactions or events.
role.label: Assets

role.documentation: Amount of net assets (liabilities).
role.label: Assets Net

role.documentation: Amount, before tax, of unrealized gain in accumulated other comprehensive income (AOCI) on investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale).
role.label: Available For Sale Debt Securities Accumulated Gross Unrealized Gain Before Tax

role.documentation: Amortized cost of investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale).
role.label: Available For Sale Debt Securities Amortized Cost Basis

role.documentation: Amount of investment in debt and equity securities categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading.
role.label: Available For Sale Securities

role.documentation: Amount before tax of unrealized gain in accumulated other comprehensive income (AOCI) on investments in debt and equity securities classified as available-for-sale.
role.label: Available For Sale Securities Accumulated Gross Unrealized Gain Before Tax

role.documentation: This item represents the cost of debt and equity securities, which are categorized neither as held-to-maturity nor trading, net of adjustments including accretion, amortization, collection of cash, previous other-than-temporary impairments recognized in earnings (less any cumulative-effect adjustments recognized, as defined), and fair value hedge accounting adjustments, if any.
role.label: Available For Sale Securities Amortized Cost

role.documentation: Amount of investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in other comprehensive income (available-for-sale).
role.label: Available For Sale Securities Debt Securities
role.positiveLabel: Total fair value investments in government-sponsored enterprises

role.documentation: Information by location on balance sheet (statement of financial position).
role.label: Balance Sheet Location [Axis]

role.documentation: Location in the balance sheet (statement of financial position).
role.label: Balance Sheet Location [Domain]

role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for basis of accounting, or basis of presentation, used to prepare the financial statements (for example, US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, Other Comprehensive Basis of Accounting, IFRS).
role.label: Basis Of Accounting Policy Policy [Text Block]

role.documentation: Facility held for productive use including, but not limited to, office, production, storage and distribution facilities.
role.label: Building [Member]

role.documentation: Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates. Excludes cash and cash equivalents within disposal group and discontinued operation.
role.label: Cash And Cash Equivalents At Carrying Value

role.documentation: Information by type of cash and cash equivalent balance.
role.label: Cash And Cash Equivalents [Axis]

role.documentation: Amount of cash and cash equivalents, and cash and cash equivalents restricted to withdrawal or usage. Excludes amount for disposal group and discontinued operations. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.
role.label: Cash Cash Equivalents Restricted Cash And Restricted Cash Equivalents

role.documentation: The amount of cash deposited in financial institutions as of the balance sheet date that is insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.
role.label: Cash F D I C Insured Amount

role.documentation: Information by type of change in accounting estimate.
role.label: Change In Accounting Estimate By Type [Axis]
role.terseLabel: Change in Accounting Estimate by Type

role.documentation: Identification of the accounting estimate that was changed that had the effect of adjusting the carrying amount of an existing asset or liability, or that will alter the subsequent accounting for existing or future assets or liabilities.
role.label: Change In Accounting Estimate Type [Domain]

role.documentation: Categorization of Variable Interest Entities (VIE) for consolidation and (or) disclosure purposes, whether individually or in aggregate, by: (1) VIEs consolidated because the entity is the primary beneficiary, (2) VIEs not consolidated because the entity is not the primary beneficiary, and (3) VIEs or potential VIEs that are not consolidated because necessary information is not available. In general, a VIE is a corporation, partnership, trust, or any other legal structure used for business purposes that either (a) does not have equity investors with voting rights or (b) has equity investors that do not provide sufficient financial resources for the entity to support its activities. A VIE often holds financial assets, including loans or receivables, real estate or other property. A VIE may be essentially passive or it may engage in research and development or other activities on behalf of another company.
role.label: Classification Of Variable Interest Entity [Domain]

The accounting policy may also address the accounting treatment for intercompany accounts and transactions, noncontrolling interest, and the income statement treatment in consolidation for issuances of stock by a subsidiary.

role.label: Receivable Type [Domain]

role.documentation: Information by name of regulatory agency.
role.label: Regulatory Agency [Axis]

role.documentation: Organization that establishes and ensures compliance with rules or regulations.
role.label: Regulatory Agency [Domain]

role.documentation: Related parties include affiliates; other entities for which investments are accounted for by the equity method by the entity; trusts for benefit of employees; and principal owners, management, and members of immediate families. It also may include other parties with which the entity may control or can significantly influence the management or operating policies of the other to an extent that one of the transacting parties might be prevented from fully pursuing its own separate interests.
role.label: Related Party [Domain]

role.documentation: Information by type of related party. Related parties include, but not limited to, affiliates; other entities for which investments are accounted for by the equity method by the entity; trusts for benefit of employees; and principal owners, management, and members of immediate families. It also may include other parties with which the entity may control or can significantly influence the management or operating policies of the other to an extent that one of the transacting parties might be prevented from fully pursuing its own separate interests.
role.label: Related Party Transactions By Related Party [Axis]

role.documentation: Amount of cash and cash equivalents restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits. Cash equivalents include, but are not limited to, short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.
role.label: Restricted Cash And Cash Equivalents

role.documentation: Type of cash and cash equivalent. Cash is currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general characteristics of demand deposits. Also includes short-term, highly liquid investments that are both readily convertible to known amounts of cash and so near their maturity that they present insignificant risk of changes in value because of changes in interest rates.
role.label: Restricted Cash And Cash Equivalents Cash And Cash Equivalents [Member]

role.documentation: The cumulative amount of the reporting entity's undistributed earnings or deficit.
role.label: Retained Earnings Accumulated Deficit

role.documentation: Information by status of funding for defined benefit plan designed to provide retirement benefits.
role.label: Retirement Plan Funding Status [Axis]

role.documentation: Status of funding for defined benefit plan designed to provide retirement benefits.
role.label: Retirement Plan Funding Status [Domain]

role.documentation: Information by name of plan designed to provide retirement benefits. Includes, but is not limited to, legal name of defined benefit and defined contribution plans.
role.label: Retirement Plan Name [Axis]

role.documentation: Name of plan designed to provide retirement benefits. Includes, but is not limited to, legal name of defined benefit and defined contribution plans.
role.label: Retirement Plan Name [Domain]

role.documentation: Information by type of retirement benefit plan. Includes, but is not limited to, retirement benefit arrangement for defined benefit pension and other postretirement plans, retirement benefit arrangement for defined contribution pension and other postretirement plans, and special and contractual termination benefits payable upon retirement.
role.label: Retirement Plan Type [Axis]

role.documentation: Type of plan designed to provide participants with retirement benefits. Includes, but is not limited to, retirement benefit arrangement for defined benefit pension and other postretirement plans, retirement benefit arrangement for defined contribution pension and other postretirement plans, and special and contractual termination benefits payable upon retirement.
role.label: Retirement Plan Type [Domain]

role.documentation: Money for usage-based right to asset.
role.label: Royalty [Member]

role.documentation: Schedule itemizing specific types of trade accounts and notes receivable, and for each the gross carrying value, allowance, and net carrying value as of the balance sheet date. Presentation is categorized by current, noncurrent and unclassified receivables.
role.label: Schedule Of Accounts Notes Loans And Financing Receivable [Table]
role.terseLabel: Schedule Of Accounts Notes Loans And Financing Receivable [Table]

role.documentation: Tabular disclosure of the various types of trade accounts and notes receivable and for each the gross carrying value, allowance, and net carrying value as of the balance sheet date. Presentation is categorized by current, noncurrent and unclassified receivables.
role.label: Schedule Of Accounts Notes Loans And Financing Receivable [Text Block]

role.documentation: Tabular disclosure of the (a) carrying value as of the balance sheet date of liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received that are used in an entity's business (accounts payable); (b) other payables; and (c) accrued liabilities. Examples include taxes, interest, rent and utilities. Used to reflect the current portion of the liabilities (due within one year or within the normal operating cycle if longer). An alternative caption includes accrued expenses.
role.label: Schedule Of Accounts Payable And Accrued Liabilities Table [Text Block]

role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
role.label: Schedule Of Available For Sale Securities [Line Items]
role.terseLabel: Schedule Of Available For Sale Securities [Line Items]

role.documentation: Tabular disclosure of the change in the benefit obligation of pension plans and/or other employee benefit plans from the beginning to the end of the period, showing separately, if applicable, the effects of the following: service cost, interest cost, contributions by plan participants, actuarial gains and losses, foreign currency exchange rate changes, benefits paid, plan amendments, business combinations, divestitures, curtailments, settlements, and special and contractual termination benefits.
role.label: Schedule Of Changes In Projected Benefit Obligations Table [Text Block]
role.terseLabel: Schedule of Change in Pension and Accrued Benefits

role.documentation: Tabular disclosure of information pertaining to short-term and long-debt instruments or arrangements, including but not limited to identification of terms, features, collateral requirements and other information necessary to a fair presentation.
role.label: Schedule Of Debt Table [Text Block]
role.terseLabel: Schedule of Debt Securities Held by Public and Accrued Interest

role.documentation: Disclosures about an individual defined benefit pension plan or an other postretirement defined benefit plan. It may be appropriate to group certain similar plans.  Also includes schedule for fair value of plan assets by major categories of plan assets by the level within the fair value hierarchy in which the fair value measurements in their entirety fall, segregating fair value measurements using quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities (Level 1), Significant other observable inputs (Level 2), and significant unobservable inputs (Level 3).
role.label: Schedule Of Defined Benefit Plans Disclosures [Table]
role.terseLabel: Schedule Of Defined Benefit Plans Disclosures [Table]

role.documentation: Table setting forth material liabilities for remediation, site restoration, postclosure, monitoring commitments, or other exit costs that may occur on the sale, disposal or abandonment of a property as a result of unanticipated contamination of the assets.
role.label: Schedule Of Environmental Exit Cost [Table]

role.documentation: Schedule of prior period adjustments to correct an error in previously issued financial statements. The disclosure may include, but is not limited to: (1) the effect of the correction on each financial statement line item and any per-share amounts affected for each prior period presented (2) the cumulative effect of the change on retained earnings or other appropriate components of equity or net assets in the statement of financial position, as of the beginning of the earliest period presented, and (3) the effect of the prior period adjustment (both gross and net of applicable income tax) on the net income of each prior period presented in the entity's annual report for the year in which the adjustments are made. This table can be used to disclose the amounts as previously reported and the effect of the correction or other adjustment on per line item or per share amount basis. This table uses as its line items financial statement line items that are affected by prior period adjustments.
role.label: Schedule Of Error Corrections And Prior Period Adjustment Restatement [Table]
role.terseLabel: Schedule Of Error Corrections And Prior Period Adjustment Restatement [Table]

role.documentation: Tabular disclosure of prior period adjustments to previously issued financial statements including (1) the effect of the correction on each financial statement line item and any per-share amounts affected for each prior period presented (2) the cumulative effect of the change on retained earnings or other appropriate components of equity or net assets in the statement of financial position, as of the beginning of the earliest period presented, and (3) the effect of the prior period adjustments (both gross and net of applicable income tax) on the net income of each prior period presented in the entity's annual report for the year in which the adjustments are made.
role.label: Schedule Of Error Corrections And Prior Period Adjustments [Text Block]
role.terseLabel: Summary of Effect of Restatements Increase (Decrease) in Previously Reported Values

role.documentation: Tabular disclosure about the type or nature of guarantees, for example performance, indemnification, payment and other guarantees, and related information such as term, origin and purpose, triggering event, maximum exposure, and carrying value. Represents the guarantor's disclosures which include the information about each guarantee, or each group of similar guarantees, even if the likelihood of the guarantor's need to make any payments under the guarantee is remote. This excludes disclosures for product warranties.
role.label: Schedule Of Guarantee Obligations [Table]

role.documentation: Tabular disclosure of the loss contingencies that were reported in the period or disclosed as of the balance sheet date.
role.label: Schedule Of Loss Contingencies By Contingency [Text Block]

role.documentation: Tabular disclosure of the carrying amounts of other assets. This disclosure includes other current assets and other noncurrent assets.
role.label: Schedule Of Other Assets Table [Text Block]

role.documentation: Disclosure of information about physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale. Includes, but is not limited to, balances by class of assets, depreciation and depletion expense and method used, including composite depreciation, and accumulated deprecation.
role.label: Schedule Of Property Plant And Equipment [Table]
role.terseLabel: Schedule Of Property Plant And Equipment [Table]

role.documentation: A table or schedule providing information pertaining to borrowings under which repayment was required in less than twelve months (or normal operating cycle, if longer) after its issuance. It may include: (1) description of the short-term debt arrangement; (2) identification of the lender or type of lender; (3) repayment terms; (4) weighted average interest rate; (5) carrying amount of funds borrowed under the specified short-term debt arrangement as of the balance sheet date and measures of the maximum and average amount outstanding during the period; (6) description of the refinancing of a short-term obligation when that obligation is excluded from current liabilities in the balance sheet; and (7) amount of a short-term obligation that has been excluded from current liabilities in the balance sheet because of a refinancing of the obligation.
role.label: Schedule Of Short Term Debt [Table]

role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
role.label: Schedule Of Trading Securities And Other Trading Assets [Line Items]
role.terseLabel: Schedule Of Trading Securities And Other Trading Assets [Line Items]

role.documentation: Disclosure of information about investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in net income (trading) and investment in equity security with change in fair value recognized in net income (FV-NI).
role.label: Schedule Of Trading Securities And Other Trading Assets [Table]
role.terseLabel: Schedule Of Trading Securities And Other Trading Assets [Table]

role.documentation: Amount, after the effects of master netting arrangements, of funds outstanding loaned in the form of a security resale agreement between the entity and another party for the purchase and resale of identical or substantially the same securities at a date certain for a specified price. Includes purchases of participations in pools of securities that are subject to a resale agreement, assets not subject to a master netting arrangement and not elected to be offset.
role.label: Securities Purchased Under Agreements To Resell
role.terseLabel: Federal funds sold and securities purchased under agreements to resell

role.documentation: Components of an entity that engage in business activities from which they may earn revenue and incur expenses, including transactions with other components of the same entity.
role.label: Segment [Domain]

role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
role.label: Short Term Debt [Line Items]

role.documentation: The entire disclosure for all significant accounting policies of the reporting entity.
role.label: Significant Accounting Policies [Text Block]

role.documentation: Designated tax department of a state or local government entitled to levy and collect income taxes from the entity.
role.label: State And Local Jurisdiction [Member]

role.documentation: Information by business segments.
role.label: Statement Business Segments [Axis]

role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
role.label: Statement [Line Items]

role.documentation: Schedule reflecting a Statement of Income, Statement of Cash Flows, Statement of Financial Position, Statement of Shareholders' Equity and Other Comprehensive Income, or other statement as needed.
role.label: Statement [Table]

role.documentation: Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called permanent equity.
role.label: Stockholders Equity

role.documentation: Detail information of subsequent event by type. User is expected to use existing line items from elsewhere in the taxonomy as the primary line items for this disclosure, which is further associated with dimension and member elements pertaining to a subsequent event.
role.label: Subsequent Event [Line Items]

role.documentation: Identifies event that occurred after the balance sheet date but before financial statements are issued or available to be issued.
role.label: Subsequent Event [Member]

role.documentation: Discloses pertinent information about one or more significant events or transactions that occurred after the balance sheet date through the date the financial statements were issued or the date the financial statements were available to be issued.
role.label: Subsequent Event [Table]

role.documentation: Information by event that occurred after the balance sheet date but before financial statements are issued or available to be issued.
role.label: Subsequent Event Type [Axis]

role.documentation: Event that occurred after the balance sheet date but before financial statements are issued or available to be issued.
role.label: Subsequent Event Type [Domain]

role.documentation: The entire disclosure for significant events or transactions that occurred after the balance sheet date through the date the financial statements were issued or the date the financial statements were available to be issued. Examples include: the sale of a capital stock issue, purchase of a business, settlement of litigation, catastrophic loss, significant foreign exchange rate changes, loans to insiders or affiliates, and transactions not in the ordinary course of business.
role.label: Subsequent Events [Text Block]

role.documentation: Line items represent financial concepts included in a table. These concepts are used to disclose reportable information associated with domain members defined in one or many axes to the table.
role.label: Summary Of Investment Holdings [Line Items]

role.documentation: Amount of investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in net income (trading) and investment in equity security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in net income (FV-NI).
role.label: Trading Securities
role.terseLabel: Total trading securities (fair value), Book Value

role.documentation: Cost of investments in debt and equity securities and other forms of securities that provide ownership interests classified as trading.
role.label: Trading Securities Cost

role.documentation: Amount of investment in debt security measured at fair value with change in fair value recognized in net income (trading).
role.label: Trading Securities Debt

role.documentation: Amortized cost of investments in debt securities classified as trading.
role.label: Trading Securities Debt Amortized Cost

role.documentation: Fair value of investments in trading equity securities and other forms of trading securities that provide ownership interests.
role.label: Trading Securities Equity
role.terseLabel: Trading Securities, Equity securities, Book Value

role.documentation: Cost of investments in equity securities and other forms of securities that provide ownership interests classified as trading.
role.label: Trading Securities Equity Cost

role.documentation: Instrument or contract that imposes a contractual obligation to deliver cash or another financial instrument or to exchange other financial instruments on potentially unfavorable terms and conveys a contractual right to receive cash or another financial instrument or to exchange other financial instruments on potentially favorable terms.
role.label: Transfers And Servicing Of Financial Instruments Types Of Financial Instruments [Domain]

role.documentation: Debentures, notes, and other debt securities issued by US government agencies, for example, but not limited to, Government National Mortgage Association (GNMA or Ginnie Mae). Excludes US treasury securities and debt issued by government-sponsored Enterprises (GSEs), for example, but is not limited to, Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (FHLMC or Freddie Mac), Federal National Mortgage Association (FNMA or Fannie Mae), and the Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB).
role.label: U S Government Agencies Debt Securities [Member]

role.documentation: Debentures, bonds and other debt securities issued by US government sponsored entities (GSEs), for example, but not limited to, Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (FHLMC or Freddie Mac), Federal National Mortgage Association (FNMA or Fannie Mae), and the Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB). Excludes debt issued by the Government National Mortgage Association (GNMA or Ginnie Mae).
role.label: U S Government Sponsored Enterprises Debt Securities [Member]

role.documentation: This category includes investments in debt securities issued by the United States Department of the Treasury, US Government Agencies and US Government-sponsored Enterprises. Such securities may include treasury bills (short-term maturities - one year or less), treasury notes (intermediate term maturities - two to ten years), and treasury bonds (long-term maturities - ten to thirty years), debt securities issued by the Government National Mortgage Association (Ginnie Mae) and debt securities issued by the Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae) or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac).
role.label: U S Treasury And Government [Member]

role.documentation: This category includes information about negotiable debt securities issued by the United States Department of the Treasury which generally have maturities of one year or less, are interest bearing, and are backed by the full faith and credit of the United States government.
role.label: U S Treasury Bill Securities [Member]

role.documentation: This category includes information about negotiable debt securities issued by the United States Department of the Treasury which generally have maturities greater than ten and as long as thirty years, are interest bearing, and are backed by the full faith and credit of the United States government.
role.label: U S Treasury Bond Securities [Member]

role.documentation: This category includes information about negotiable debt securities issued by the United States Department of the Treasury which generally have maturities of one to ten years, are interest bearing, and are backed by the full faith and credit of the United States government.
role.label: U S Treasury Notes Securities [Member]

role.documentation: This category includes information about debt securities issued by the United States Department of the Treasury and backed by the United States government. Such securities primarily consist of treasury bills (short-term maturities - one year or less), treasury notes (intermediate term maturities - two to ten years), and treasury bonds (long-term maturities - ten to thirty years).
role.label: U S Treasury Securities [Member]

role.documentation: Defined benefit plan in which retirement benefits are payable directly from general assets of employer sponsoring plan.
role.label: Unfunded Plan [Member]

role.documentation: Guarantee by US government-sponsored enterprises, including but not limited to, Federal National Mortgage Association (FNMA) or Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (FHLMC) for government insured loans.
role.label: Us Government Sponsored Enterprise Insured Loans [Member]

role.documentation: Disclosure of accounting policy for the use of estimates in the preparation of financial statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles.
role.label: Use Of Estimates

role.documentation: Information by category of Variable Interest Entity (VIE).
role.label: Variable Interest Entities By Classification Of Entity [Axis]

role.documentation: Variable Interest Entities (VIE) in which the entity has a controlling financial interest (as defined) and of which it is therefore the primary beneficiary. A controlling financial interest is determined based on both: (a) the entity's power to direct activities of the VIE that most significantly impact the VIE's economic performance and (b) the entity's obligation to absorb losses of the VIE that could potentially be significant to the VIE or the right to receive benefits from the VIE that could potentially be significant to the VIE. VIEs of which the entity is the primary beneficiary are included in the consolidated financial statements of the entity.
role.label: Variable Interest Entity Primary Beneficiary [Member]

role.documentation: A loan guaranteed up to certain limits by the Veterans Administration on a principal residence.
role.label: Veterans Administration Loan [Member]

role.documentation: Expiration date of outstanding warrant and right embodying unconditional obligation requiring redemption by transferring asset at specified or determinable date or upon event certain to occur, in CCYY-MM-DD format.
role.label: Warrants And Rights Outstanding Maturity Date

role.documentation: Carrying value as of the balance sheet date of obligations and payables pertaining to claims incurred of a workers compensation nature.
role.label: Workers Compensation Liability Current And Noncurrent

role.documentation: Accounts and taxes receivable net.
role.label: Accounts And Taxes Receivable Net

role.verboseLabel: Total accounts and taxes receivable, net

role.documentation: Accounts and taxes receivable, net.
role.label: Accounts And Taxes Receivable Net [Text Block]

role.label: Accounts Payable [Line Items]

role.label: Accrued Benefits Payable

role.documentation: Advances and prepayments.
role.label: Advances And Prepayments [Member]

role.documentation: Age for reserve retirees.
role.label: Age For Reserve Retirees

role.documentation: Agency and government-sponsored enterprise-backed securities.
role.label: Agency And Government Sponsored Enterprise Backed Securities [Member]

role.documentation: Aggregate insure loss threshold amount.
role.label: Aggregate Insure Loss Threshold Amount

role.documentation: Airport and airway trust fund.
role.label: Airport And Airway Trust Fund [Member]

role.label: All Other Agencies [Member]

role.documentation: All other commitments.
role.label: All Other Commitments [Member]

role.documentation: All other fiduciary activities.
role.label: All Other Fiduciary Activities [Member]

role.documentation: All other funds from dedicated collections.

role.terseLabel: All Other Funds From Dedicated Collections

role.documentation: All other guaranteed loan programs.
role.label: All Other Guaranteed Loan Programs [Member]

role.documentation: All other programs.
role.label: All Other Program [Member]

role.documentation: All other programs and funds.
role.label: All Other Programs And Funds [Member]

role.documentation: American international group, incorporation.
role.label: American International Group Incorporation [Member]

role.documentation: Annual increase of insured loss threshold.
role.label: Annual Increase Of Insured Loss Threshold
role.terseLabel: Annual increase of insured loss threshold

role.documentation: Assets held for funds collected on outstanding postal money orders and undelivered articles.
role.label: Assets Held For Funds Collected On Outstanding Postal Money Orders And Undelivered Articles
role.terseLabel: Assets held on behalf of others on outstanding postal money orders and undelivered defense articles

role.terseLabel: Assets held on behalf of others

role.terseLabel: Schedule of Benefits Due and Payable

role.documentation: Benefits due and payable.

role.label: Blessings Of Liberty [Member]
role.terseLabel: Secure the Blessings of Liberty to Ourselves and our Posterity

role.documentation: Bonus.
role.label: Bonus [Member]

role.documentation: Burial benefits.
role.label: Burial Benefits [Member]

role.documentation: Accounts payable is a liability account reflecting amounts owed to private persons or organizations for goods and services received by a government.
role.label: Cafr Accounts Payable

role.documentation: Accrued interest payable.
role.label: Cafr Accrued Interest Payable

role.documentation: Accrued wages and related liabilities payable.
role.label: Cafr Accrued Wages And Related Liabilities Payable
role.terseLabel: Accrued federal employees’ wages and benefits

role.documentation: The total amount of depreciation expense that has been recorded from the time the asset was put into service until the date of the balance sheet.
role.label: Cafr Accumulated Depreciation And Amortization

role.documentation: Asset valuation allowances for losses, such as those on tenant receivables, should be deducted from the assets or groups of assets to which the allowances relate, with appropriate disclosure.
role.label: Cafr Allowance For Doubtful Accounts

role.documentation: Resources with present service capacity that the government presently controls.
role.label: Cafr Assets

role.documentation: The amount after accumulated depreciation and amortization of physical assets such as land, improvements to land, easements, buildings, building improvements, vehicles, machinery, equipment, works of art and historical treasures, infrastructure, construction in progress, and all other tangible or intangible assets that have been, or will be, used in operations and that have initial useful lives extending beyond a single reporting period. Infrastructure assets are long-lived capital assets that normally are stationary in nature and can be preserved for a significantly greater number of years than most capital assets.
role.label: Cafr Capital Assets

role.documentation: Amount before accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization of physical assets used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale.
role.label: Cafr Capital Assets Being Depreciated

role.documentation: Currency, coins, checks, money orders, and bankers' drafts on hand or on deposit with an official or agent designated as custodian of cash or demand deposits with financial institutions. Cash equivalents are short-term highly liquid investments including Treasury bills, commercial paper, and money market funds.
role.label: Cafr Cash And Cash Equivalents

role.documentation: Changes in net position which is the difference in net position between the beginning and end of the reporting period.
role.label: Cafr Change In Net Position [Abstract]

role.documentation: Liabilities related to environmental and disposal activities.
role.label: Cafr Environmental And Disposal Liabilities

role.documentation: Excess (deficiency) of revenues over (under) expenditures.
role.label: Cafr Excess Deficiency Of Revenues Over Under Expenditures

role.documentation: Expenditures.
role.label: Cafr Expenditures

role.documentation: Expenditures for capital outlay which can include construction such as production, additions, replacements, or major structural alterations to buildings and other improvements. May also include purchase of equipment, land, and existing structures including capital leases.

role.documentation: Grants, contributions and donations from federal governmental entities.

role.terseLabel: Pre-authorized amount to the state to establish construction projects

role.documentation: Grants payable.
role.label: Cafr Grants Payable

role.documentation: Carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of interest earned but not received. Also called accrued interest or accrued interest receivable.

role.documentation: Inventories, which are materials and supplies on hand for future consumption or goods held for resale rather than for use in operations.

role.verboseLabel: Total inventories and related property, net

role.documentation: Liabilities related to loan guarantees such as direct student loans.
role.label: Cafr Loan Guarantee Liabilities

role.documentation: Loans receivable.

role.documentation: Cash flows from from providing services and producing and delivering goods, and include all transactions and other events that are not defined as capital and related financing, noncapital financing, or investing activities. Cash flows from operating activities generally are the cash effects of transactions and other events that enter into the determination of operating income.
role.label: Cafr Net Cash Provided By Used In Operating Activities
role.terseLabel: Decrease in operating cash held by treasury

role.documentation: Net position represents the difference between all other elements in a statement of financial position and should be displayed in three components namely net investment in capital assets, restricted (distinguishing between major categories of restrictions), and unrestricted.
role.label: Cafr Net Position

role.documentation: Other post-employment benefits plan, classified as liability, defined as the government's total liability for other post-employment benefits less the fiduciary net position of OPEB plans in which the government has an interest.
role.label: Cafr O P E B Liability

role.documentation: Other assets which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Assets are resources with present service capacity that the government presently controls.
role.label: Cafr Other Assets

role.documentation: Other liabilities which the reporting entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. Liabilities are present obligations to sacrifice resources that the government has little or no discretion to avoid.
role.label: Cafr Other Liabilities

role.documentation: Program revenues, net.
role.label: Cafr Program Revenues Net

role.documentation: Amount of cash restricted as to withdrawal or usage. Cash includes, but is not limited to, currency on hand, demand deposits with banks or financial institutions, and other accounts with general characteristics of demand deposits.
role.label: Cafr Restricted Cash

role.documentation: Revenue from investment income which is compensation for the use of financial resources over a period of time.
role.label: Cafr Revenue From Investment Income

role.documentation: The sum of all types of taxes collected.
role.label: Cafr Revenue From Taxes

role.documentation: Revenues, net.
role.label: Cafr Revenues Net

role.documentation: The portion of taxes receivable estimated not to be collectible.
role.label: Cafr Tax Allowances

role.documentation: Used as an identifier for Governmental activities, Business type activities or Primary Governmental activities.
role.label: Cafr Type Of Activities [Axis]

role.documentation: Type of activities.
role.label: Cafr Type Of Activities [Domain]

role.terseLabel: Callable Capital Subscriptions for Multilateral Development Banks

role.label: Capital Reserve Amount Under Purchase Agreement
role.terseLabel: Capital reserve amount under purchase agreement
